description: From Latin referendum (“that which ought to be announced”), from refero (“I announce”).

entries.meaning: (politics) A direct popular vote on a proposed law or constitutional amendment. The adposition on is usually used before the related subject of the vote.
examples: In some cases, a referendum on the proposed bond issue must be held.

entries.meaning: An action, choice, etc., which is perceived as passing judgment on another matter.
examples: My father is taking my decision on whether to go to university as a referendum on his performance as a parent, and it's very stressful.
